meanings.sent1: The cloddish man struggled to understand the simple instructions.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed by her cloddish mistake in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The cloddish cat tried to chase its own tail, failing miserably.
meanings.sent4: His cloddish behavior at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The cloddish student always needed extra help to grasp basic concepts.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a clod or clodhopper
meanings.sent1: The cloddish boots left muddy tracks all over the clean floor.
meanings.sent2: The old farmhouse had a cloddish charm that reminded her of simpler times.
meanings.sent3: The cloddish scarecrow in the field seemed to wave at passing crows.
meanings.sent4: His cloddish hands fumbled with the delicate china teacup.
meanings.sent5: The cloddish vehicle struggled to navigate the narrow country roads.
